did.abstract: Aaron Leonard is a writer and historian whose primary focus is the history of radicalism and state suppression of radicalism. Leonard is the author of Heavy Radicals: The FBI's Secret War on America's Maoists (2014) and A Threat of the First Magnitude: FBI Counterintelligence and Infiltration from the Communist Party to the Revolutionary, 1962-1974 (2017). The Aaron Leonard Collection of FOIA Files consists of pdfs of declassified Federal Bureau of Investigation documents requested by Leonard through the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Materials include pdfs of FBI reports and memoranda on composer Aaron Copland, actor Howard Da Silva, and Harvey Matusow documenting the subjects' employment, residences, daily activities, travel, and political affiliations, especially any documented or perceived connection to the Communist Party of the United States of America (CPUSA). The files document the federal surveillance of figures in the performing arts during the 1940s and 1950s for evidence of subversive or treasonous actions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Aaron Leonard in September 2018; the accession number associated with this gift is 2018.123.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. An access terminal for born-digital materials in the collection is available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Researchers may view an item's original container and/or carrier, but the physical carriers themselves are not available for use because of preservation concerns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Aaron Leonard Collection of FOIA Files; TAM 762; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials were described on the collection-level. Groupings of individual pdf documents are original to the donor's directory structure. New York University Libraries follow professional standards and best practices when imaging, ingesting, and processing born-digital material in order to maintain the integrity and authenticity of the content.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Aaron Leonard is a writer and historian whose primary focus is the history of radicalism and state suppression of radicalism. Leonard is the author of Heavy Radicals: The FBI's Secret War on America's Maoists (2014) and A Threat of the First Magnitude: FBI Counterintelligence and Infiltration from the Communist Party to the Revolutionary, 1962-1974 (2017). He is also a regular contributor to the History News Network, Truthout, and Jacobin.
